title: Tales of Murder
description: A murder mystery short story, novella & novel website.

items.title: Score None for the Chair
items.author: Thomas Thursday
items.content_html: “Look, bub, when you’ve been in the crime-chipping business as long as I have, you’ll learn that a criminal investigator has two duties. One is to prove guilt; the other is to prove innocence.”

items.title: The Case of the Dog-Biter
items.content_html: “When a man dies, my dear Hawke,” said Dr. Wilthorpe, lighting a cigar, “he usually gives up playing the fool, but not so Alderman Wickham."

items.title: Butterfly of Death
items.author: Harold Gluck
items.content_html: A queer kind of a chuckle hit my eardrum. “You’re Joe Delaney,” repeated the voice, and then it added, “So you think you can take my little Butterfly away from me and nothing will happen to you?”

items.title: The Guerilla
items.author: Clinton Harcourt
items.content_html: The man walked past the building, turned, and after a quick glance about, entered the tenement’s hallway.

items.title: Murder in Small Packages
items.author: William Rough
items.content_html: Good-hearted Benny Kerr only wanted to hand that mislaid meat parcel back to its loser. But when it turned out that the package contained an axe-maniac's tidbit, it was the murder-mad chopper that wanted to make Benny the red-handed receiver.

items.title: Gunning for Death
items.author: James L. Harfe
items.content_html: Branded as a yellow dog who let his best friend die, Dan Wilkins strikes back at the unknown traitor in the department, who was profiteering in blood and murder.

items.title: The Ironclad Alibi
items.author: Gunnison Steele
items.content_html: Nick Ryan could prove he wasn't the murderer being sought for—prove it with the finality of the grave.

items.title: The Long Arm of God
items.author: Ward Sterling
items.content_html: Without a sign of undue haste, Halligan buckled his belt and holster about his waist. Coolly he unbuttoned the holster and drew the gun. He cocked the weapon and, with his finger on the trigger, waited for the others to settle their argument.

items.title: Fit for a King
items.author: Walter Deffenbaugh
items.content_html: Millionaire James J. Plainfield ordered a house ‘fit for a king’ but when four leading industrialists tied to the American war effort disappear, a team of special federal law enforcement officers are called in to investigate the House of a Cliff and its hidden mysteries.

items.title: Coffin Nail Piracy
items.author: Neil Moran
items.content_html: Dying for smokes, that desperate gang would go to any extreme to get them, including …
